page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: Stamford is a focal point for road transport serving local villages and towns. The town is not suitable for large amounts of traffic due to narrow streets, but now the A1 bypass alleviates the pressure of this traffic. A traffic count taken on the A1 and parallel minor road, B1081, recorded the following results: Friday 21st June, 11-12am (1 hour) road car cvan van lor mbik LOR A1 1206 039 072 195 027 255 B1081 294 000 039 042 009 009 The river activity based on the welland has dwindled but it is still navigable for leisure activities. Stamford also has a railway station, on the line from Birmingham to Peterborough.
